{"step_by_step_thinking": "Systemic Juvenile Rheumatoid Arthritis, also known as Still's disease, is characterized by several symptoms. These include a rash, fever, and hepatosplenomegaly, which is an enlargement of the liver and spleen. However, uveitis, which is inflammation of the uvea in the eye, is not a common feature of systemic Juvenile Rheumatoid Arthritis. It is more commonly associated with other types of Juvenile Rheumatoid Arthritis, such as oligoarticular and polyarticular.", "answer_choice": "A"}
